items.name: Component_Frame
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Component_Frame
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Component_Frame extends gs.Component_Visual
    ###*
    * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used
    * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc.
    * 
    * @method onDataBundleRestore.
    * @param Object data - The data-bundle
    * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context.
    ###
    onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) ->
        @setupEventHandlers()
        
    ###*
    * A frame constructs a graphical frame from its skin-image. The frame can
    * rendered by tiling or strechting the four sides of the frame. A frame
    * is useful for creating In-Game UI windows and boxes. For more info about 
    * the skin-image format, see help-file.
    * 
    * @module gs
    * @class Component_Frame
    * @extends gs.Component_Visual
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    * @param {gs.Viewport} viewport An optional native viewport object.
    ###
    constructor: (viewport) ->
        super()
        
        ###*
        * The native frame-object.
        * @property frame
        * @type gs.Frame
        ###
        @frame = new gs.Frame(viewport ? Graphics.viewport)
        
        ###*
        * The name of the skin-image used to construct the frame.
        * @property image
        * @type string
        * @protected
        ###
        @image = null
        
        
    ###*
    * Disposes the frame.
    * 
    * @method dispose
    ###    
    dispose: ->
        super
        @frame.dispose()
        
    ###*
    * Adds event-handlers for mouse/touch events
    *
    * @method setupEventHandlers
    ### 
    setupEventHandlers: ->
        @frame.onIndexChange = =>
            @object.rIndex = @frame.index
            
    ###*
    * Setup the frame component. This method is automatically called by the
    * system.
    * @method setup
    ###
    setup: ->
        @setupEventHandlers()
    
    ###*
    * Updates the padding.
    * 
    * @method updatePadding
    ###  
    updatePadding: ->
        if @object.padding?
            @frame.x += @object.padding.left
            @frame.y += @object.padding.top
            @frame.width -= (@object.padding.left+@object.padding.right)# / @object.zoom.x
            @frame.height -= (@object.padding.top+@object.padding.bottom)# / @object.zoom.y
    
    ###*
    * Updates the frame properties from the game object properties.
    *
    * @method updateProperties
    ###
    updateProperties: ->
        @frame.x = @object.dstRect.x #- @object.dstRect.width * (@object.zoom.x - 1.0) * @object.anchor.x
        @frame.y = @object.dstRect.y #- @object.dstRect.height * (@object.zoom.y - 1.0) * @object.anchor.y
        @frame.width = @object.dstRect.width
        @frame.height = @object.dstRect.height
        @frame.thickness = @object.frameThickness || 16
        @frame.cornerSize = @object.frameCornerSize || 16
        @frame.clipRect = @object.clipRect
        @frame.visible = @object.visible
        @frame.ox = -@object.origin.x
        @frame.oy = -@object.origin.y
        @frame.zoomX = @object.zoom.x
        @frame.zoomY = @object.zoom.y
        @frame.angle = @object.angle || 0
        @frame.opacity = @object.opacity
        @frame.z = (@object.zIndex || 0) + (if !@object.parent then 0 else @object.parent.zIndex || 0)
    
    ###*
    * Updates the optional sprite properties from the game object properties.
    * @method updateOptionalProperties
    ###
    updateOptionalProperties: ->
        if @object.tone?
            @frame.tone = @object.tone
        if @object.color?
            @frame.color = @object.color
        if @object.viewport?
            @frame.viewport = @object.viewport
        if @object.effects?
            @frame.wobble = @object.effects.wobble
        if @object.anchor?
            @frame.anchor.x = @object.anchor.x
            @frame.anchor.y = @object.anchor.y
            
    ###*
    * Updates the frame's skin-image used to construct the frame.
    *
    * @method updateImage
    ###
    updateImage: ->
        if @object.image? and @image != @object.image
            @image = @object.image
            bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap("#{@object.imageFolder||"Graphics/Pictures"}/#{@object.image}")
            @frame.skin = bitmap
        
    ###*
    * Updates the frame's padding, properties and skin-image.
    * 
    * @method update
    ###   
    update: ->
        super

        @object.rIndex = @frame.index
        @updateProperties()
        @updateOptionalProperties()
        @updatePadding()
        @updateImage()
        
        

        
        
        
gs.Component_Frame = Component_Frame
